don't say it Soulstice, wait till it happens then DO it, thats why it's cal=
led Roll Playing.


  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Soulstice Omega=
 
  To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Saturday, June 30, 2001 7:22 PM
  S=
ubject: Re: Dear owners of the Cybers...


  OOC: Okay, I'm sorry, but it's=
 the truth. My characters could not co-exist in the same faction like that,=
 ad then what? Make them act unrealistic? To keep them in character of cour=
se the Mafia would attack the Chivtrons, and then  who would I have die? As=
 much as I like them, my Chivtrons would end up dying. It's not a threat, h=
onest, I'm just pointing out what would really happen. Sorry if you took it=
 as a threat...

    ----- Original Message ----- 
    From: Yanshosh@aol.c=
om 
    To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
    Sent: Saturday, June 30, 2001 10:24=
 PM
    Subject: Re: Dear owners of the Cybers...


    If anyone continues=
 to post on the subject of factions and stuff OOC, I'll have rAuq kneecap t=
hem. Now, for the (hopefully) final commant on this:

    First of all: Sou=
lstice, that was just plain cheap. Its threats like those that make people =
not want people's chars in their faction. "If you do this, I'll kill off my=
 chars on your side" is exactly what makes faction commanders begin to rely=
 on your chars less and less, resulting in them being ignored.

    Second =
of all: as Gunthers said, quit trying to predict what the Alliance is gonna=
 do. You're all wrong so far anyways.



    --- In nbwrpg@y..., "Soulstice=
 Omega" <thecode@p...> wrote:
    > OOC: I did a poll. Want to vote in it? =
All I'm saying is that if there is an alliance, all of my Chivtrons are goi=
ng to die. I didn't really want that, though...
